- The former professional kickboxer and his brother Tristan were detained on Thursday for an initial 24 hours alongside two Romanian suspects, prosecutors from the anti-organised crime unit said after raiding their properties in Bucharest. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/romania-detains-ex-kickboxer-andrew-tate-human-trafficking-case-2022-12-30/ published on 2022-12-30 00:00:06
correction_response:
This tweet is partially correct. Elon Musk did allow Andrew Tate back on Twitter after taking over the platform, and Tate did have a feud with Greta Thunberg. However, it's misleading to suggest that Thunberg's actions led to Tate's arrest. Tate was arrested in Romania as part of a human-trafficking investigation, not because of his Twitter activity. His social media posts did provide evidence of his location, but the investigation had been ongoing since April. 
https://www.reuters.com/world/romania-detains-ex-kickboxer-andrew-tate-human-trafficking-case-2022-12-30/
https://www.insider.com/greta-thunberg-mocks-andrew-tate-about-his-arrest-pizza-boxes-2022-12
note_1_text: A spokesperson for Romania’s anti-organized crime agency refuted widespread claims that authorities were tipped off to Tate's location by a pizza box seen in a video Tate posted in response to climate activist Greta Thunberg: "Funny, but no."  https://apnews.com/article/romania-crime-bucharest-organized-human-trafficking-0b65ac32442d995e590ab70c221398a1
note_2_text: As much as man would love this to be true, it is not. Appears this rumor began, without supporting evidence, via the Tweet linked below:    https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/andrew-tate-arrested-jerrys-pizza-box/  https://twitter.com/esqueer_/status/1608579412588650496?s=46&t=R9XNs0mXBHi_GeZD1pEZZQ

refute_evidences: - Many social media platforms banned him over his comments but his Twitter account became active again in November after Elon Musk took over the platform. In one of his tweets following his return to Twitter, Tate said he was flying to California to tell Musk he was "a legend". - Following online speculation that the brand of pizza featured in the video helped police confirm Tate's presence in Romania, Thunberg quipped on Twitter that "this is what happens when you don't recycle your pizza boxes". However, the anti-organised crime unit representative said it was not the case that Tate's arrest had been made as a result of the pizza boxes. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/romania-detains-ex-kickboxer-andrew-tate-human-trafficking-case-2022-12-30/ published on 2022-12-30 00:00:06

- It came after Tate, an influencer known for misogynistic posts, picked a fight with Thunberg , a Swedish teen climate activist, bragging about his carbon emissions and prompting a put-down from the 19-year-old activist. - Not long after on Thursday, Tate was arrested by Romanian authorities in Bucharest as part of a human-trafficking investigation. Officials accuse Tate, his brother, and two others of forcing women to make porn to be sold online, according to Reuters. - Influencers and politicians have a history of raising their profile thanks to feuds and drama that garner attention, often using the quote-tweet function to call out large ideologically opposed accounts, which can often grab more eyeballs. tweet_category: Technology, Social Media, and Big Tech
tweet_text: So...Elon Musk let Andrew Tate back on Twitter, and Tate promptly used it to reveal his whereabouts to authorities in Romania who then arrested him. All because Greta Thunberg owned him so hard his little wee-wee fell off. Do I have that right? Please say I have that right.
user_description: I am a parody of myself, if anyone wonders if this is really me.
